III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 07/30/2024, Youth A was kicked out of the group home
because he broke a window. Administrator 2 told Youth A to get
off his "effing" property and off his "effing" grass. Youth A was not
allowed to gather his belongings. Youth A was mistreated by the
group home staff. The staff would yell and swear at Youth A.
Youth A was manipulated, humiliated, and berated by the staff.
Youth A has been afraid to speak out about the mistreatment due
to fear of retaliation.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via phone on 8/5/2024. She
reported receiving the allegations from Youth A. She reported not
speaking to any staff from Pine Way directly and the allegations
are based on Youth A’s report only. She was unable to identify
which staff is alleged to have told Youth A that Youth A is no
longer welcome at Pine Way.
Administrator 2 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/5/2024. He reported an incident report was submitted on 7/30/24
for the incident outlined in the allegations but Administrator 2 was
not present at the beginning of the incident. Prior to arriving at the
facility, Administrator 2 received a phone call from Staff 1 telling
him Youth A was upset and Administrator 2 needed to speak with
Youth A. Upon arriving at the facility, Administrator 2 found Youth
A in his bedroom being rude to others (youth and staff) and hitting
things in his room. He reported trying to deescalate Youth A but
having little success. They stepped outside of the building and
Program Manager joined them on the back porch. Administrator 2
told Youth A to go for a walk because this was a technique Youth
A would use to calm himself down. Administrator 2 reported Youth
A stated, “I’m going to act like six-year-old because that is what
2

you want me to do”. Staff 3 was also present at this time and
Youth A went for a walk. Administrator 2 left after Youth A. When
Administrator returned to the facility, Law Enforcement was pulling
up. He informed Law Enforcement that Youth A was welcome at
the facility and could stay if Youth A wanted. He reported telling
Law Enforcement that the facility would like Youth A to stay at the
facility. Youth A refused to stay and was taken to a local shelter by
Law Enforcement. Youth A returned to the facility at approximately
7:30pm. At this time Administrator 1 had arrived at the facility and
spoke with Youth A. Administrator 2 was not present for this
interaction. Administrator 2 reported speaking with Case Manager
about Youth A’s belongings and understanding that Youth A’s
medication and clothing would be picked up the next day.
Administrator 2 denied knowing anything about the allegation of
making a former employee disappear if they talked about the
facility.
Program Manager was interviewed at the facility face to face
on 8/5/2024. She reported Staff 3 informed Program Manager that
Youth A had returned and was standing on the back porch.
Program Manager reported hearing a loud noise from the porch
area and she looked out the window and observed a large rock on
the porch next to Youth A’s foot. She yelled through the window
that she wanted to talk with Youth A about where he was at
emotionally. She informed Youth A she would not be coming
outside because Youth A had a “weapon” (rock). She reported
Youth A picked up the rock and backed away from the building but
staying on the porch. Youth A began walking back and forth on
the porch, so Program Manager called 911. She reported telling
Staff 3 to bring the other youth into the office and as they were
entering the office, Youth A threw the large rock through the
window in the dining room. Once in the locked office, she reported
calling 911 back and reporting the broken window. She heard
more glass being broken and heard Youth A come into the
building and walk to his bedroom. After hearing Youth A leave the
building, she came out of the office and observed Youth A riding
his bike in circles in the parking lot. She reported a significant
amount of glass in the dining room and living room and that the
window had been cleared of all glass. Staff 3 called Administrator
2 to inform him of the situation and Youth A went into the woods
behind the building.
During the conversation between Youth A and Administrator 2,
Program Manager denied any negative statements were made to
Youth A and that he was encouraged to stay at the facility. She
also denied any staff ever made discouraging remarks to Youth A
3

and he was always supported by all staff including Administrator
2.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/5/2024. She reported being the primary therapist for Youth A at
the facility. She reported the focus of therapy sessions was
helping Youth A deal with trauma from his past, but he struggled
to stay focused on this goal. Youth A would begin to open up but
quickly become defensive and shut down, refusing to attend
sessions. She denied ever witnessing staff mistreat or become
negative with Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility face to face on 8/5/2024.
She reported not being present during the incident with the broken
window since she left the building at the end of her shift. She
reported informing Administrator 2 that Youth A appears to be
upset over something and appeared to be in a negative mood.
She denied that any staff had been negative towards Youth A and
believed Administrator 2 “went above and beyond” with Youth A to
the point of giving him extra privileges to help Youth A be
successful. She reported no staff swear at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/5/2024. He reported only being at the facility for a short time but
believes it to be a good place and feels safe. He was unable to
recall the incident with Youth A. He reported never hearing staff
swear or be mean to youth.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/5/2024. He reported feeling safe and has never heard staff
swear or be negative towards youth in the program.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility face to face on 8/5/2024.
She reported being present but only interaction was with Law
Enforcement when they asked if Youth A was welcome back into
the program. She reported telling Law Enforcement that Youth A
was more than welcome back into the program. She denied any
staff swear or present with a negative attitude towards youth in the
program.
Administrator 1 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/5/2024. She reported being informed by Administrator 2 and
Program Manager about the situation prior to arriving at the
facility. She reported being at Pine Way North when Youth A
came back to the facility after breaking the window. Administrator
1 reported Youth A presented with a very flat affect and when
4

asking about the situation, told Administrator 1 that this action is
what everyone wanted. Youth A stated he broke the window
because he was no longer wanted at the house and now having
committed a felony he couldn’t be at the house. Administrator 1
reported telling Youth A he was very welcome to stay and was
wanted at the program. She reported telling Youth A that no one
can put him out of the program and if he wants to come back, he
is welcome. Youth A told her he has a place to stay which is
different than in the past where it was “scary” being in the street.
Once Administrator 2 gave Youth A his backpack, Youth A left and
the AWOL process was initiated. Administrator 1 reported no staff
belittle or mistreat Youth A and Youth A had a habit of nitpicking
the staff. This has caused Administrator 1 to engage in “a lot of
coaching” with staff to handle the nitpicking of Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility face to face on 8/5/2024.
She reported being present during the incident of the window
being broke. She reported Youth A came to the dining room
window and Staff 3 informed Program Manager. Program
Manager began to put on her shoes to go out and speak with
Youth A but upon realizing Youth A had a rock decided to not go
out. Staff 3 went to the window but didn’t see a rock, then heard
Youth A yell “watch out and get back” and then observed a rock in
Youth A’s hand. Program Manager told Staff 3 to gather the other
youth and place them in the office and during this action, Staff 3
called Administrator 2 and Staff 1 while Program Manager called
Law Enforcement. Once in the office, Staff 3 heard a loud crash
and the sound of glass breaking. She came out of the office after
hearing Youth A leave the building. She reported observing glass
throughout the dining room and living room. It appeared that
Youth A had used a chair to finish breaking the glass in the
window frame. When looking out the window, Staff 3 observed
Youth A riding his bike in circles in the parking lot. When Law
Enforcement arrived at the building, Staff 3 reported telling the
same story to them. She reported no staff mistreated or was
belittling to Youth A nor any other youth.
Men with Purpose 1 was interviewed via phone on 8/6/2024.
He reported having knowledge of where Youth A has been
staying. Youth A is staying at the local mission at night and
Community Mental Health during the day. He reported Youth A
may be moving to a house that the Men with Purpose program
operates in the area. He provided a phone number for Men with
Purpose 2 who is operating this house.
Men with Purpose 2 was interviewed via phone on 8/6/2024.
He reported Youth A is staying with another individual at the Men
5

with Purpose program house in Kalamazoo. He provided the
phone number for Men with Purpose 3.
Men with Purpose 3 was interviewed via phone on 8/7/2024.
He reported Youth A is staying at the Men with Purpose house
and provided the address.
Case Manager was interviewed via phone on 8/7/2024. She
reported Youth A told her he was standing up for another youth
and was upset over staff’s interaction with this other youth
(unidentified). Youth A told her he believed staff were talking
about him causing him to become more upset and acting out. She
also reported Youth A doesn’t know how to communicate when
upset and will lose control of his emotions when upset. Case
Manager reported Youth A is currently receiving temporary
housing with the Men with Purpose program in Kalamazoo. She
reported Youth A does not want to return to Wayne County, so
she developed a safety plan for his stay in the community.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 8/9/2024. She reported
working with Youth A and never witnessing staff mistreat or belittle
Youth A in any manner of interaction. There has been no swearing
by staff nor negative talk towards Youth A. She reported the staff
have been very uplifting and positive when dealing with Youth A.
She reported being surprised that Youth A didn’t return after
running away since this is what he will generally do when upset.
Youth A was interviewed at his current location face to face
on 8/9/2024. Youth A reported Administrator 2 told Youth A after a
Staff (unidentified) quit, that Staff may come up missing if she
talks about what happens at the facility. Youth A was unable to
provide any further details about this incident. Youth A reported
staff will yell, swear, and tell youth to "shut up" but was unable to
provide any specific information about when and who. Youth A
reported that once Youth C was told to shut up by staff but again,
unable to identify the staff or other information. In regard to the
incident with the window, Youth A reported never being told by
Administrator 1 to stay at the facility and having Administrator 2
tell Youth A to leave the “effing property” in front of Law
Enforcement. Youth A then stated Law Enforcement may have not
heard because the officer was in the car at the time. Youth A
reported the incident with him breaking the window began when
he was trying to kill a spider in his bedroom causing Administrator
2 to ask him what was going on and after being told, Administrator
2 told Youth A to take a walk. Youth A told Administrator 2 that
there should be no spiders in the house because it should be
6

clean. Youth A reported upon returning to the facility, he broke
the window with a rock to show Administrator 2 that the facility
was no better than facilities Youth A had been in the past.
Documents Reviewed:
MDHHS-5985 Incident Report dated 7/30/24 for Youth A. This
document outlines the incident that occurred in this special
investigation with Youth A breaking a window at the facility. It is
documented the incident began when Youth A was requested to
clean up dirt that he tracked into the facility. Youth A is
documented as following this request but becoming frustrated
when staff informed him that a check of his cleaning up would
occur later in the day. Youth A went outside for approximately five
minutes before returning to his bedroom where he began to
engage in aggressive behaviors. He is documented as yelling,
screaming, laughing while hitting the walls in the bedroom and
closet. Youth A is documented as speaking to Administrator 2 and
stating that Youth A no longer wants to be lodged in the facility.
Youth A was encouraged to walk around the block to calm himself
down (documented as a coping skills) and upon return, staff
observed Youth A with a rock on the back porch. Staff are
documented as asking Youth A to sit down on the porch and calm
himself and de-escalate himself. At this time, staff heard Youth A
yell back up and look out. The rest of this incident reports matches
what staff reported while interviewed. The interaction between
Administrator 1 and Youth A is documented as explained during
the interview of Administrator 1. It is documented that once
receiving his requested items from Administrator 2, Youth A stated
I just want to go, I am 18 and I can live independently. A debrifing
took place with staff.
Law Enforcement incident/investigation report Kalamazoo
Department of Public Safety #24-009961 Dated 8/12/2024 @
11:43:28. This report outlines the incident described in the
allegations. Law Enforcement arrived at the facility and found
Administrator 2, Program Manager, and Staff 3. Staff 3 informed
Law Enforcement that Youth A had broken the back window with a
large rock and Program Manager concured with this statement.
Both reported to Law Enforcement the same report given when
interviewed for this special investigation. Administrator 2 reported
to Law Enforcement that he would be filing for an immediate
discharge of Youth A.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as aside from Youth A, all staff
and youth interviewed denied staff used inappropriate language or
threats toward youth.
7

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered to the facility in regard to
screening possible referrals to ensure they match the criteria for
admission.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
